Speaking of biofilms, part of the reason the Flint Water to got lead in it from the pipes is the sudden change in water pH killed the biofilm in the pipes which allowed the acidic water of the Flint river to leech the lead from the pipes

I sure hope they find a treatment for Dry Eye from this.  I suffer from it badly and put sterile drops in my eyes about 10-20 a day depending on what I am doing; with being outdoors and computer time being the worst.  Unfortunately, a few years back all the companies who make these drops jumped on the "Get The Red Out" bandwagon.  In case you didn't know it and have used these they work by contracting the blood vessels in your eyes thereby getting rid of the blood that makes your eyes red in the first place.  This is a bad thing to do often, it reduces the nutrition to the eye and allows waste to build up.  Anyway, it is hard now to find plain saline and maybe alligators will help me.  Kind of weird now that I think of it.  Finally, I wonder if putting electrolytes in your eyes would be even better.  I don't think I'm going to go out and buy a bottle of electrolyte water, but it is tempting.
